primary_snippets.title: Scientists Think Beetle's Armor Could Provide Clues To Stronger Buildings

primary_snippets.snippet_description:
Now scientists are studying what the bug’s crush-resistant shell could teach them about designing stronger planes and buildings.
Other local beetle species shattered under one-third as much pressure.
Researchers then used electron microscopes and CT scans to examine the beetle’s exoskeleton and figure out what made it so strong.
In the structure of the beetle’s shell, nature offers an “interesting and elegant” alternative, Zavattieri said.
Scientists say the armor of the seemingly indestructible beetle could offer clues for designing stronger planes and buildings.
primary_snippets.title: Scientists Think Beetle's Armor Could Provide Clues To Stronger Buildings

primary_snippets.snippet_description:
MIAMI (AP) — Epsilon has strengthened into a hurricane, the 10th of the Atlantic season, as it approaches Bermuda on Thursday.
A tropical storm watch is in effect for Bermuda and residents have been urged to closely monitor the storm.
11 PM AST Tuesday, October 20 Key Messages for Hurricane #Epsilon.
https://t.co/22MmuRtUyj pic.twitter.com/owzBtcSrjr — National Hurricane Center (@NHC_Atlantic) October 21, 2020The Miami-based hurricane center said Epsilon had maximum sustained winds of 75 mph late Tuesday.
This year’s hurricane season has had so many storms that the Hurricane Center has turned to the Greek alphabet for storm names after running out of official names.
primary_snippets.title: Epsilon Strengthens Into A Hurricane As It Approaches Bermuda
